channel.title: CVE Feed for Symantec Corporation -- Symantec Endpoint Encryption
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Symantec Corporation -- Symantec Endpoint Encryption

item.title: CVE-2017-15526|2024-08-05T19:57:26.294Z -- symantec%20corporation -- symantec%20endpoint%20encryption
item.description: Prior to SEE v11.1.3MP1, Symantec Endpoint Encryption can be susceptible to a null pointer de-reference issue, which can result in a NullPointerException that can lead to a privilege escalation scenario.

item.title: CVE-2017-15525|2024-08-05T19:57:26.296Z -- symantec%20corporation -- symantec%20endpoint%20encryption
item.description: Prior to SEE v11.1.3MP1, Symantec Endpoint Encryption can be susceptible to a denial of service (DoS) attack, which is a type of attack whereby the perpetrator attempts to make a particular machine or network resource unavailable to its intended users by temporarily or indefinitely disrupting services of a specific host within a network.

item.title: CVE-2017-13683|2024-08-05T19:05:18.959Z -- symantec%20corporation -- symantec%20endpoint%20encryption
item.description: In Symantec Endpoint Encryption before SEE 11.1.3HF3, a kernel memory leak is a type of resource leak that can occur when a computer program incorrectly manages memory allocations in such a way that memory which is no longer needed is not released. In object-oriented programming, a memory leak may happen when an object is stored in memory but cannot be accessed by the running code.
